story:
About Ambionics
 

My name is Ben.  I’ve been on an extraordinary journey over the past two years which started when my son was born.  Sadly, Sol lost most of his lower left arm due to a blood clot following an injury at birth.  

I responded as any parent would have. I looked into how Sol would be treated and what support we could expect.  I quickly learned that many toddlers abandon prosthetics early on and I wanted to know why so Sol would stand a better chance. Calling on my psychology background and my passion for engineering, I started doing my own research.  I noticed big gaps in what was being offered and saw lost opportunities at several key stages.  Rather than complain, I decided to do something about it and set up Ambionics. 

(Above) Dressing change at Alder Hey Children's Hospital post-amputation

We deliver a totally new kind of online service and are currently developing unique functional prosthetic solutions (including our world famous hydraulic technology) for children with upper limb differences everywhere.    

Our first press release (March 1 this year) went viral.  The response was truly out of this world and our story was covered in every Country and in every language. Most of the media attention centred on the hydraulic prototype we are working on. 

It's inspired by the way spiders use fluid to move their legs (to find out more please follow the press links below). However, there is much more to Ambionics besides this.  Let me explain...

 

Early Intervention


Children are usually given their first prosthetic arm between 6 and 12 months of age. We introduce prosthetics much sooner - one month after an amputation (as in the case of my son) or from the moment a child with a limb difference arrives home from hospital.  The director for innovation at NHS Wales described our research based approach as ‘potentially revolutionary’. 

 

Replace casting with scanning


Normally parents must take time off work to attend appointments at specialist centres which might be hundreds of miles away from where they live.  A prosthetist then creates a plaster cast mould of the affected arm and this is used to make a crude socket.  Young children often find this stressful.  They can wriggle and resist when the cast is taken and any sudden jerk can result in a poor fitting socket and a poor first experience of prosthetics. 

At Ambionics, parents simply scan their child’s arm while they are asleep then upload the file to our online platform. We do the rest and deliver the prosthetic through the postal service! Simple! It takes about five minutes to do the scan and 40 minutes for us to model a socket. It’s worth noting that within two years all phones and hand held devices will come with a scanning application built in.

(above) The first 3D printed prototype, April 2016

 

5 Day Turn Around (compared to 6 - 11 weeks)


A traditional prosthetic can take as long as 11 weeks to make. 
From a fresh scan, we can produce a new arm within a matter of hours

 

Backup Copies


If a traditional prosthetic is misplaced or damaged it can take five weeks to get an appointment for a re-mould, and another 11 weeks before the replacement arm arrives (that’s four months without an arm!).  At Ambionics we just print another from the digital copy we keep.

 

Reduced Waste


Traditional prosthetics are discarded after use.  To help keep costs down and reduce our carbon footprint, Ambionics only replace parts that need replacing or upgrading – this is usually just the detachable socket.   

 

Managing Growth Rates


Traditionally, children receive two arms per year (based on NHS service) which means that for a lot of the time the socket is either too tight or too loose.  Plaster cast arms are designed to be slightly oversized so children can grow into them. This is a false economy in our opinion because loose or unsecure arms and ones that are too tight don’t inspire confidence. It’s easy to see why so many children stop wearing them. We recommend at least four or five sockets per year depending on the needs of the child.   

 

Making Devices More Accessible


In most cases, cosmetic arms are made of fibre glass coated in varnish with a functionless silicone hand (often described as creepy looking).  These are surprisingly expensive for what they are! In the US, a cosmetic arm can cost as much as $5,000!  Our knowledge of 3D printing and scanning has the potential to seriously reduce these costs, making prosthetics accessible to children everywhere (and anywhere!)

We also believe in customising the look of the hand.  We want to help break the stigma of 'cosmetic' prosthetic devices by offering bold colours and a choice of designs for infants. 
We even encourage older children to take part in the design process.  What better way to meet a young person's needs than to enable them to produce their own assistive devices and accessories!

For a more detailed write-up of the background, the importance of early intervention and the cutting edge science of Ambionics, please read this article

 

Why Crowd Fund?

 

On April 10 we announced that we are offering 20 families the chance to participate in our BETA programme - a free trial of the Ambionics service. 

Within 24 hours of the announcement, over 30 families from 9 countries (from 5 continents) registered their interest. The desire to help us to iron out creases and revolutionise infant prosthetics has been overwhelming – from families, from within the life science industry and through the NHS here in Wales.

We are working alongside several multi-national companies including Autodesk and Stratasys  with the research being conducted through Bangor University.  These amazing organisations immediately recognised Ambionics' potential and have helped us in several important ways.  However, there are only four team members at Ambionics and only two of us work on a full time basis  (myself and Jason Griggs).  We currently volunteer our time for Ambionics for free but our savings have run out and we are not ready for investment yet. As much as we love doing this we have financial commitments just like everyone else.  We had two options – go for a bank loan or try crowd funding. 

We are looking for contributions which will allow us to buy equipment for prototyping our unique hydraulic products and helping us to complete the beta trials. We have had a lot of interest from investors but we are not quite ‘investor ready’ yet and are still working on the business plan - the trials will provide the missing information that we need.  For now we are depending on the goodwill of the Indiegogo community and fund raisers everywhere to help get us to the next stage. If you would rather help by making a PayPal donation then please feel free to use the facility on our website - Thank you!

 

(Above) CAD illustration of the latest functional hydraulic prototype

 

What do the experts think?

 

"NHS Wales' research and development department supports the work being carried out at Ambionics, which has the potential to revolutionise the care of infants with upper limb differences.”

- Dr Nefyn Williams, Director of Innovation, BCUHB, NHS Wales

"It’s been inspiring to work on this innovative and ambitious project. It is amazing that, despite Ben having no background in product design, he’s taught himself enough to create something that will not only help his own son Sol, but potentially lots of others facing the same challenges too.” 

-  Paul Sohi, Product Designer, Autodesk

“This case is indicative of 3D printing’s ability to improve lives by overcoming the traditional barriers of low-volume manufacturing, We continue to support and enable innovators like Ben to bring customization to mainstream prosthetics manufacture" 

-  Scott Rader, General Manager, Healthcare Solutions, Stratasys.

"3D printing has been around for many years for rapid prototyping and is only recently creating waves in manufacturing across many key industrial sectors in the U.K.  The potential for 3D printing in advancing healthcare technology is significant. The proposition and creative genius of Ambionics in using 3D printing and new materials to the benefit of prosthetics has the potential to revolutionise the lives of thousands of children (and adults) in the U.K. alone. I believe this product is a true game changer that creates a significant step change in the field of prosthetics." 

- Dr Louise Jones, 3D printing/Additive manufacturing lead, Knowledge Transfer Network

 

What do the press think?

 

 


 

 

 

ISRAELI NATIONAL NEWS
http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.asp...

RTL NEXT
http://rtlnext.rtl.de/cms/nach-armamputation-va...

PHOTOXELS
http://www.photoxels.com/stratasys-3d-printing-...

ENGINEERING BY DESIGN
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=veibSnoLk4A&amp...

GOOD MORNING BRITAIN,ITV
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d6A0Xm7uPzE

MSN
http://www.msn.com/en-us/video/peopleandplaces/...
story_txt: About Ambionics My name is Ben.  I’ve been on an extraordinary journey over the past two years which started when my son was born.  Sadly, Sol lost most of his lower left arm due to a blood clot following an injury at birth.  I responded as any parent would have. I looked into how Sol would be treated and what support we could expect.  I quickly learned that many toddlers abandon prosthetics early on and I wanted to know why so Sol would stand a better chance. Calling on my psychology background and my passion for engineering, I started doing my own research.  I noticed big gaps in what was being offered and saw lost opportunities at several key stages.  Rather than complain, I decided to do something about it and set up Ambionics. (Above) Dressing change at Alder Hey Children's Hospital post-amputationWe deliver a totally new kind of online service and are currently developing unique functional prosthetic solutions (including our world famous hydraulic technology) for children with upper limb differences everywhere.    Our first press release (March 1 this year) went viral.  The response was truly out of this world and our story was covered in every Country and in every language. Most of the media attention centred on the hydraulic prototype we are working on. It's inspired by the way spiders use fluid to move their legs (to find out more please follow the press links below). However, there is much more to Ambionics besides this.  Let me explain... Early InterventionChildren are usually given their first prosthetic arm between 6 and 12 months of age. We introduce prosthetics much sooner - one month after an amputation (as in the case of my son) or from the moment a child with a limb difference arrives home from hospital.  The director for innovation at NHS Wales described our research based approach as ‘potentially revolutionary’.  Replace casting with scanningNormally parents must take time off work to attend appointments at specialist centres which might be hundreds of miles away from where they live.  A prosthetist then creates a plaster cast mould of the affected arm and this is used to make a crude socket.  Young children often find this stressful.  They can wriggle and resist when the cast is taken and any sudden jerk can result in a poor fitting socket and a poor first experience of prosthetics. At Ambionics, parents simply scan their child’s arm while they are asleep then upload the file to our online platform. We do the rest and deliver the prosthetic through the postal service! Simple! It takes about five minutes to do the scan and 40 minutes for us to model a socket. It’s worth noting that within two years all phones and hand held devices will come with a scanning application built in.(above) The first 3D printed prototype, April 2016 5 Day Turn Around (compared to 6 - 11 weeks)A traditional prosthetic can take as long as 11 weeks to make. From a fresh scan, we can produce a new arm within a matter of hours Backup CopiesIf a traditional prosthetic is misplaced or damaged it can take five weeks to get an appointment for a re-mould, and another 11 weeks before the replacement arm arrives (that’s four months without an arm!).  At Ambionics we just print another from the digital copy we keep. Reduced WasteTraditional prosthetics are discarded after use.  To help keep costs down and reduce our carbon footprint, Ambionics only replace parts that need replacing or upgrading – this is usually just the detachable socket.    Managing Growth RatesTraditionally, children receive two arms per year (based on NHS service) which means that for a lot of the time the socket is either too tight or too loose.  Plaster cast arms are designed to be slightly oversized so children can grow into them. This is a false economy in our opinion because loose or unsecure arms and ones that are too tight don’t inspire confidence. It’s easy to see why so many children stop wearing them. We recommend at least four or five sockets per year depending on the needs of the child.    Making Devices More AccessibleIn most cases, cosmetic arms are made of fibre glass coated in varnish with a functionless silicone hand (often described as creepy looking).  These are surprisingly expensive for what they are! In the US, a cosmetic arm can cost as much as $5,000!  Our knowledge of 3D printing and scanning has the potential to seriously reduce these costs, making prosthetics accessible to children everywhere (and anywhere!)We also believe in customising the look of the hand.  We want to help break the stigma of 'cosmetic' prosthetic devices by offering bold colours and a choice of designs for infants. We even encourage older children to take part in the design process.  What better way to meet a young person's needs than to enable them to produce their own assistive devices and accessories!For a more detailed write-up of the background, the importance of early intervention and the cutting edge science of Ambionics, please read this article Why Crowd Fund? On April 10 we announced that we are offering 20 families the chance to participate in our BETA programme - a free trial of the Ambionics service. Within 24 hours of the announcement, over 30 families from 9 countries (from 5 continents) registered their interest. The desire to help us to iron out creases and revolutionise infant prosthetics has been overwhelming – from families, from within the life science industry and through the NHS here in Wales.We are working alongside several multi-national companies including Autodesk and Stratasys  with the research being conducted through Bangor University.  These amazing organisations immediately recognised Ambionics' potential and have helped us in several important ways.  However, there are only four team members at Ambionics and only two of us work on a full time basis  (myself and Jason Griggs).  We currently volunteer our time for Ambionics for free but our savings have run out and we are not ready for investment yet. As much as we love doing this we have financial commitments just like everyone else.  We had two options – go for a bank loan or try crowd funding. We are looking for contributions which will allow us to buy equipment for prototyping our unique hydraulic products and helping us to complete the beta trials. We have had a lot of interest from investors but we are not quite ‘investor ready’ yet and are still working on the business plan - the trials will provide the missing information that we need.  For now we are depending on the goodwill of the Indiegogo community and fund raisers everywhere to help get us to the next stage. If you would rather help by making a PayPal donation then please feel free to use the facility on our website - Thank you! (Above) CAD illustration of the latest functional hydraulic prototype What do the experts think? "NHS Wales' research and development department supports the work being carried out at Ambionics, which has the potential to revolutionise the care of infants with upper limb differences.”- Dr Nefyn Williams, Director of Innovation, BCUHB, NHS Wales"It’s been inspiring to work on this innovative and ambitious project. It is amazing that, despite Ben having no background in product design, he’s taught himself enough to create something that will not only help his own son Sol, but potentially lots of others facing the same challenges too.” -  Paul Sohi, Product Designer, Autodesk“This case is indicative of 3D printing’s ability to improve lives by overcoming the traditional barriers of low-volume manufacturing, We continue to support and enable innovators like Ben to bring customization to mainstream prosthetics manufacture" -  Scott Rader, General Manager, Healthcare Solutions, Stratasys."3D printing has been around for many years for rapid prototyping and is only recently creating waves in manufacturing across many key industrial sectors in the U.K.  The potential for 3D printing in advancing healthcare technology is significant. The proposition and creative genius of Ambionics in using 3D printing and new materials to the benefit of prosthetics has the potential to revolutionise the lives of thousands of children (and adults) in the U.K. alone. I believe this product is a true game changer that creates a significant step change in the field of prosthetics." - Dr Louise Jones, 3D printing/Additive manufacturing lead, Knowledge Transfer Network What do the press think?     ISRAELI NATIONAL NEWShttp://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.asp...RTL NEXThttp://rtlnext.rtl.de/cms/nach-armamputation-va...PHOTOXELShttp://www.photoxels.com/stratasys-3d-printing-...ENGINEERING BY DESIGNhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=veibSnoLk4A&amp...GOOD MORNING BRITAIN,ITVhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d6A0Xm7uPzEMSNhttp://www.msn.com/en-us/video/peopleandplaces/...

story:
Benjamin Bradley | The Intersection Of Fashion And Technology

 

 

 

 

RFID BLOCKING CREDIT CARD HOLDERS

(IDENTITY THEFT PROOF)

Statistics show that people on average charge their mobile devices at least twice a day. Never worry about finding a kiosk or hidden outlet again with the Classic Lux backpack!

Key features such as weather-proof material, Premium Vegan Leather and secret RFID Blocking(Identity Theft Proof) pockets that will keep your belongings safe during your commutes.

Water-Proof Nylon Material

Premium Vegan Leather

RFID BLOCKING POCKETS

Besides being the most stylish & safe backpack it is also the the most convenient backpack with features such as: an integrated USB charging port, easy access pockets, carry-on approved design.

USB CHARGING PORT

 

 

ACHIEVING UNIVERSAL ENERGY ACCESS

Energy is central to nearly every major challenge, and opportunity the world faces today. Be it jobs, security, climate change, food production or increasing incomes , access to sustainable energy for all is essential for strengthening economies, protecting ecosystems and achieving equity.

Worldwide, about 1.2 billion people have no access to electricity and the development benefits it brings, and 1 billion more have access only to unreliable electricity networks. Nearly 3 billion people rely on traditional biomass (such as wood and charcoal) for cooking and heating. 

This lack of modern energy services stifles income-generating activities and hampers the provision of basic services such as health care and education. In addition, smoke from polluting and inefficient cooking, lighting, and heating devices kills an estimated four million people a year and causes a range of chronic illnesses and other negative health impacts. These emissions are also important drivers of climate change and local environmental degradation.

Each bag sold, a portion of the proceeds will goto a family in an impoverished country with out electricity!

Shipping

Please note that all US pledges are including shipping costs, so we will not charge extra shipping costs. The Pledge amount is the total.

International shippers will pay according to each country jurisdiction.

Risks and challenges

Our team has invested months preparing for the launch for this backpack design, and have full working examples of our products.

We are in close contact with the facility and they are very much prepared for the production when this venture is completely funded.

Additionally our team is set up to by and by check each shipment that will go out to ensure all backers will get each item with no defaults.

Our challenges won't be the producing side, however generally the fulfillment side. We have a good goal in our delivery times, and plan to convey every one of the backpacks even before the due date said on this page.

For this venture we set up an exceptional team that is exclusively centered around noting any inquiries you may have for us, and we'll make a point to answer to all messages within 24 hours.

All in all - Nothing to lose sleep over!

story:
Subanero - BOY'ISH' BLING

The 1st

Kid Inspired 

Modern

Jewelry Brand

As a mom of 2 boys and designer of the Suba Man, I live for fashion and everything cool!  This pendant chain signature piece is a cutting-edge essential children's accessory. He's a futuristic little super[hero] that embodies originality and style. Far from a cheesy plastic necklace! It adds a minimal accent to any modern urban look. 

Small People | Big Business

Let's face it, before having kids you thought you'd never spend more than $20 on shoes for a baby. Now you're preggo and you're researching "what's best for the baby." That includes, the best of EVERYTHING! You're no dummy, fashion for kids today is on the rise and it's become a hobby for parents to dress their kids up like mini-me's and take pics of them all day EVERYDAY! Post to Facebook or Instagram and before you know it, you've got a little model on your hands with more followers than Kim K. If you're "that mom" then you probably have searched and searched for the perfect boy accessory for his ultra monochromatic swagged out look! Right?....look no further

Oh but we're giving back!

Even though I've created the Suba Man to set the trend for an epic starting point in boys jewelry, there's an even Bigger goal in mind.

    Ever heard of Cookies for Kids' Cancer? It's a dope childhood cancer foundation that funds research for safer and more effective therapies for kids with cancer. In case you didn't know, cancer is the #1 cause of death in children in the United States and only 4 out of 12 types of cancer have a survival rate over 80%.

For every $10 donated to our campaign, $1 is given to the charity!


Your help will go along way!

The money raised here on Indiegogo will fund the SUBA dream to take this brand to the top! Recently I have been offered to open a Subanero & Co. kiosk in an upscale Westfield Shopping  Mall here in the U.S. The monthly lease is $2500 for a minimum of 6 months. So 3/4 of the funds will go to secure the first month's rent and security deposit and 2nd month's rent. The rest of the money will go to purchasing the following business equipment:

Ipad with stand/card reader [$500]

Kiosk fixtures and stands [$500]

Liability insurance [$1000]

    Funds are not the only way to support

    Make some noise! Don't be shy to share this to your social media pages! Your support will never go unnoticed!

story:
WE NEED TO HIT OUR GOAL OF $15,000 to complete our first order of mass production!

How can YOU help?

1.     On the right, there are a list of Luku Pre-Ordering Options. These are called “PERKS”. If there is one that you would like to get, click "GET THIS PERK" on the box.

2.     Fill out your shipping information and continue with your payment.

* “Perk” = Pre-Order Option. This is a way for YOU to not only support Luku in its first ever mass production, but also get our amazing product(s) in return at a SPECIAL LAUNCH DISCOUNT!

                                                   

                       

                                  THE CLASSIC SNAPBACK HAT

The history of the snapback hat design began in the 1980s and spanned through the 1990s in urban cities like Los Angeles and New York. It began to be adopted as an urban symbol of soul and artistry.  Not only were snapback hats wildly collected with urban styles, but they became a fashion accessory for all types of people from all walks of life.

 

 

 

WHAT IS A LUKU SNAPBACK WATCH?

The world’s first hybrid design of a snapback hat and watch—a snapback watch. It's a watch, which for the first time ever, places a new emphasis on the opposite side. Because of this unique customizable feature, the snapback watch stands above all the redundant styles other watches express.  

 
 

 

With our name Luku meaning unique, we decided to have our watch face designs represent that. While they are all different, there is one common feature - Interchangeable Snapback Bands.

 

 

The Premium Athletic Bands are available for either S/M or M/L length.

 

 

 

The main feature of our watches is our unique interchangeable snapback bands that can be changed to fit your style preference.

 

 

TECHNICAL INFO

  • Case Material: 316L Carbon Stainless Steel
  • Case Diameter: 40mm 
  • Face Diameter: 37mm
  •  Bezel Width: 2mm Maximum
  •  Band Width: 20mm 
  • Dial Window Material: Crystal Mineral Glass 
  • Display: Analog Movement Seiko VX19 (Japanese Quartz) 
  • Date Function: Yes 
  • Pin: Stainless Steel 
  •  Water Resistant: 3 ATM

 

 


 

INTERCHANGEABILITY OF SNAPBACK BANDS

The variety of colors offered in the bands, loops, and snaps allows for complete and total customization for a look that is perfectly unique to you. Below are a few examples of combinations that could work. Sometimes all that is needed is just changing the Snap, but in the reality, the possibilities are endless! 

After our campaign, we plan to continue to produce more colors and designs.
 

 

 

 

 
 

 

 

The Luku Snapback Watch is a provisional patent watch design that was drafted for supernal comfort, durability, and adjustability, all whilst maintaining the fresh style our customers desire. The unique hybrid design fits our customers' unique fashion styles that change on a day-to-day basis.  

The unique Snap feature not only allows for this fresh style and individuality to be expressed in different colors, but also allows for a one-size-fits-all feature on the premium athletic band.  

Does the world need another watch brand? 

It is an interesting question, and it has only one answer: Not really. There are enough watch brands creating slightly different looks, but none have radically transformed the style like Luku Watches. Luckily, Luku isn't your typical watch brand; we are reinventing watches.

A better product—a better style. Our product is for the trendsetter in everyone.  

 

LUKU WATCHES WARRANTY

We want our consumers to not only love this new style, but also feel confident in their purchase’s ability to last. We ensure a two-year limited warranty for our watches, meaning that if there are any manufacturer’s defects that incur within a two-year time frame after initial purchase, we will either fix or replace the watch for free. This warranty includes all internal parts of the watch.

Warranty does not cover:  

  • Wear and tear (e.g. scratched crystal, alteration of the color of band, etc.)
  • Any damage to the product resulting from abusive use and/or negligent treatment (e.g. accidental dents, water damage, broken watch face, etc.) 

 

 

FUTURE RETAIL PRICING AND BREAKDOWN

 

 

 

For the past three years, we have made prototypes through an established manufacturing company in Shenzhen, China called Acrivia Innovations  known for its quality control. Our relationship with our manufacturers has been phenomenal. The watch faces and bands are evidence of the countless hours of work spent together to develop a watch that is unlike anything out there. With us, our manufactures are determined to build Luku's movement into a world wide known brand.

 After many occasions of visiting the factory to evaluate the stages in making our watches (the bands specifically as they are completely unique to Luku) we are 100% confident that their facilities meet all necessary regulations for operations and will deliver these quality products.

 

PRODUCTION TIMELINE

 

 

WHEN FUNDED, HOW WILL LUKU FULFILL ORDERS?

Our structural designs have been finalized and mass production is ready to be underway. 

 Once Indiegogo releases the funds after reaching our goal, we will pay the initial deposit to begin production.  Mold production takes roughly 30 days, as does the production of the watches. Add those 60 days to the estimated freight time and in all it should be about 70-80 days total. After production and packaging, our team will ship the orders to our amazing backers.

 

*Please note that our ability to complete production is dependent upon your support of backing us. We hope that with your help we can make our campaign a success.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

PRODUCT SHOWCASE GALLERY

 

 

 

LUKU LIFESTYLE  LOOK BOOK 

 

 

OUR PATH TO THE FUTURE

    Product Image
    We aim to build a global brand with a collection of watches that are always unique and one step ahead of the trends of the day, all the while staying at an affordable cost. 
    Beginning immediately, we plan to create more options for style in addition to the silicone Premium Athletic Band, while still maintaining the snapback element that makes Luku so unique. 
    Brand Image
    Meanwhile, as we grow, we want to establish our brand as more than just products, but a culture & community of unique artists who seek to rise toward their creative goals by supporting each other. We did it in a simple way--a watch. Our goal is to promote individuals with unique and innovative artistic talent weekly in our newsletters, on our website, through our social media, and collaborate with them throughout our music festivals and many projects throughout the country. 

     

    SOCIAL MEDIA

    Social media plays an enormous role in the advertising world. We hope that it will play a big role in the success of this campaign. If you like our watches and believe in our movement, follow us on social media, and please share with your friends/family! With your efforts, we can make Luku a prominent and established brand known throughout the world!

    FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/lukuwatches/

    INSTAGRAM: https://www.instagram.com/lukuwatches/

    TWITTER:  https://twitter.com/lukuwatches

     

     

    RISKS AND CHALLENGES

    Our Main Challenge

    Our main challenge with Luku Watches will be getting the word out. We are confident that our unique product will take the world by storm and grow stronger as it time goes on. We will strive to get the word out with all the avenues that are available to us and with all the resources we have. We hope that as we do, our project will stand out from the rest. We want to reach as many people as possible. And we hope that our fans, friends, families, and social media influencers can help spread the word to the world!

    The Next Challenge

    Upon funding, the next challenge will be that we can obtain by survey all the necessary and correct sizes, watch model choices, and band designs to the complete satisfaction of our backers. We believe that with our incredible manufacturing team, everything will go well. And all backers will be completely happy with their band sizes, as they will be given the option of either S/M or M/L and different color choices.

    FAQ
    Q: Why should I contribute to the campaign early?
    A: Great question! We offer limited time prices to incentivize our amazing backers to support early in the campaign! Over time our perk pricing will gradually increase. In other words, the earlier you contribute, the more money you will save!

    Q: I already backed the campaign. How do I choose my style?
    A: After the campaign has been funded, we’ll contact you via email so you can finalize your preferred style selection(s)!

    Q: Can I contribute to more than one perk at a time?
    A: Of course! That sort of support is what makes our backers so amazing! Multiple perks are separate transactions. Simply keep track of them in the ‘My Contributions’ section of your Indiegogo account.

    Q: Is there Men's and Women's Watches?
    A: For now, everything is unisex; we've found through our surveys that for all 6 of the watches offered, both men and women want to rock em'!

    Q: Are the silicone bands adjustable?
    A: Yes! The unique snap feature not only allows for fresh style, but also allows for a one-size-fits-all feature on the premium athletic band.  

    Q: Is there a warranty? 1 year or 2 year?
    A: Of course! We want you to be completely satisfied with your purchase. And so we offer a limited 2-year warranty that covers any defects from the manufacturer in which we will either repair or replace it free of cost for you!

    Q: Is your product patented?
    A: It is currently patent pending.

    Q: How do I ask a question that’s not on this list?
    A: We would love to hear any questions, comments, and all feedback from our amazing backers! Leave your questions in the comments section and we will get you an answer ASAP! You also can email us at contact@lukuwatches.com

    Q: How long after it funds should it take to get my watch?
    A: Factory production takes about two months after all the orders have been taken. To receive, package, quality control and shipping to you, it should be about two and a half months in all after the end campaign date!

LUKU WATCHES WARRANTY
We want our consumers to not only love this new style, but also feel confident in their purchase’s ability to last. We ensure a two-year limited warranty for our watches, meaning that if there are any manufacturer’s defects that incur within a two-year time frame after initial purchase, we will either fix or replace the watch for free. This warranty includes all internal parts of the watch.
Warranty does not cover:  

Wear and tear (e.g. scratched crystal, alteration of the color of band, etc.)
Any damage to the product resulting from abusive use and/or negligent treatment (e.g. accidental dents, water damage, broken watch face, etc.) 

 
 
FUTURE RETAIL PRICING AND BREAKDOWN   For the past three years, we have made prototypes through an established manufacturing company in Shenzhen, China called Acrivia Innovations  known for its quality control. Our relationship with our manufacturers has been phenomenal. The watch faces and bands are evidence of the countless hours of work spent together to develop a watch that is unlike anything out there. With us, our manufactures are determined to build Luku's movement into a world wide known brand. After many occasions of visiting the factory to evaluate the stages in making our watches (the bands specifically as they are completely unique to Luku) we are 100% confident that their facilities meet all necessary regulations for operations and will deliver these quality products. PRODUCTION TIMELINE  WHEN FUNDED, HOW WILL LUKU FULFILL ORDERS?Our structural designs have been finalized and mass production is ready to be underway.  Once Indiegogo releases the funds after reaching our goal, we will pay the initial deposit to begin production.  Mold production takes roughly 30 days, as does the production of the watches. Add those 60 days to the estimated freight time and in all it should be about 70-80 days total. After production and packaging, our team will ship the orders to our amazing backers. *Please note that our ability to complete production is dependent upon your support of backing us. We hope that with your help we can make our campaign a success.       PRODUCT SHOWCASE GALLERY   LUKU LIFESTYLE  LOOK BOOK   OUR PATH TO THE FUTUREProduct ImageWe aim to build a global brand with a collection of watches that are always unique and one step ahead of the trends of the day, all the while staying at an affordable cost. Beginning immediately, we plan to create more options for style in addition to the silicone Premium Athletic Band, while still maintaining the snapback element that makes Luku so unique. Brand ImageMeanwhile, as we grow, we want to establish our brand as more than just products, but a culture & community of unique artists who seek to rise toward their creative goals by supporting each other. We did it in a simple way--a watch. Our goal is to promote individuals with unique and innovative artistic talent weekly in our newsletters, on our website, through our social media, and collaborate with them throughout our music festivals and many projects throughout the country.  SOCIAL MEDIASocial media plays an enormous role in the advertising world. We hope that it will play a big role in the success of this campaign. If you like our watches and believe in our movement, follow us on social media, and please share with your friends/family! With your efforts, we can make Luku a prominent and established brand known throughout the world!FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/lukuwatches/INSTAGRAM: https://www.instagram.com/lukuwatches/TWITTER:  https://twitter.com/lukuwatches  RISKS AND CHALLENGESOur Main ChallengeOur main challenge with Luku Watches will be getting the word out. We are confident that our unique product will take the world by storm and grow stronger as it time goes on. We will strive to get the word out with all the avenues that are available to us and with all the resources we have. We hope that as we do, our project will stand out from the rest. We want to reach as many people as possible. And we hope that our fans, friends, families, and social media influencers can help spread the word to the world!The Next ChallengeUpon funding, the next challenge will be that we can obtain by survey all the necessary and correct sizes, watch model choices, and band designs to the complete satisfaction of our backers. We believe that with our incredible manufacturing team, everything will go well. And all backers will be completely happy with their band sizes, as they will be given the option of either S/M or M/L and different color choices.FAQQ: Why should I contribute to the campaign early?A: Great question! We offer limited time prices to incentivize our amazing backers to support early in the campaign! Over time our perk pricing will gradually increase. In other words, the earlier you contribute, the more money you will save!Q: I already backed the campaign. How do I choose my style?A: After the campaign has been funded, we’ll contact you via email so you can finalize your preferred style selection(s)!Q: Can I contribute to more than one perk at a time?A: Of course! That sort of support is what makes our backers so amazing! Multiple perks are separate transactions. Simply keep track of them in the ‘My Contributions’ section of your Indiegogo account.Q: Is there Men's and Women's Watches?A: For now, everything is unisex; we've found through our surveys that for all 6 of the watches offered, both men and women want to rock em'!Q: Are the silicone bands adjustable?A: Yes! The unique snap feature not only allows for fresh style, but also allows for a one-size-fits-all feature on the premium athletic band.  Q: Is there a warranty? 1 year or 2 year?A: Of course! We want you to be completely satisfied with your purchase. And so we offer a limited 2-year warranty that covers any defects from the manufacturer in which we will either repair or replace it free of cost for you!Q: Is your product patented?A: It is currently patent pending.Q: How do I ask a question that’s not on this list?A: We would love to hear any questions, comments, and all feedback from our amazing backers! Leave your questions in the comments section and we will get you an answer ASAP! You also can email us at contact@lukuwatches.comQ: How long after it funds should it take to get my watch?A: Factory production takes about two months after all the orders have been taken. To receive, package, quality control and shipping to you, it should be about two and a half months in all after the end campaign date!

story:
Short Summary

I'm in the nightclub concert series entertainment business for over 20 years. This invention was discovered because of the drama my customers go through losing their valuable cell phones on a weekly basis, It took me two year to solve this problem by making the 'UNIVERSAL PHONE LEASH"
This campaign is important to help develop the UNIVERSAL PHONE LEASH to reach the people that in need for this product to protect their phones. So i need your support and contributions to make it happen.. As they say "One hand don't Clap"

What We Need & What You Get

The funding for this campaign is to manufacture this product overseas in quantities and ship it back to the United States so it's affordable to the public. if we don't reach our entire goal we will cover the difference of the manufacturing cost and still ship it to our contributors when the product is ready.  This product is already in process in China. 

The Impact

  • This project is valuable to our contributor and to the world of it's unique idea:

  • NEW! Unisex, Simple technology for everyone/ Heavy Duty, Strong Retractable 17" nylon cord mobile system for everyone/ Never Misplace/ Lose or Drop your expensive cell phone again. Comparable to all Brands including iphones/ Samsung phones up to 8.5cm Wide. Muti-Colors/ Full access to all Buttons, Touchscreen, Camera in seconds. Anti-Slip Grip phone clip. Watch short VIDEO for more details.


Risks & Challenges

We have no challenges or risk whatsoever ! This product is a cell phone accessory and new to the market, It's one of kind, nothing like it in the whole world, Fully tested, Well designed, Good quality. We hope our contributors will enjoy it and have a peace of mind protecting their expensive cell phones.
Provisional Patent US 62/283,821  Granted: 10/07/2015
THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
What are High Heeled Hybrids

High Heeled Hybrids combine modern technology with a high level of craftsmanship, using 3D printing as well as traditional shoe making techniques in the production process.


Where did the concept of High Heeled Hybrids come from?

As a shoe designer, I was interested in combining concepts deriving from organic, natural structures as well as modern technology. I have always appreciated how natural structures and living organisms look, and I wanted to utilize these concept ideas into my shoe designs. Thus I began exploring how natural structures could be incorporated into high heels.


The making of High Heeled Hybrids


The process started with hand drawings and continued with my design ideas being reproduced using 3-D software. Then followed a prototyping process, with several designs being considered before the final decisions were made.  During this process I created complex heel structures inspired by natural load-bearing structures – refining designs until I was satisfied with the aesthetics of the shoes.

The finished heels were then 3D Printed using Selective Laser Sintering (SLS) technology, sanded and spray-painted. The 3D Printing material is strong and flexible providing the excellent support needed for a heel. 

The shoe uppers were fabricated using textured cow leathers as part of my High Heeled Hybrids. This inspiration came from the natural texture, and continued the theme of nature throughout my designs. The white leather also adds a soft texture to the shoes. 

Furthermore, the black embossing leather was made using a stamp which was created using 3-D design software. These embossing patterns were also inspired by shapes found in nature.

As a shoe designer I consider footwear not only from the perspective of its appearance, but also I believe it should be like creating a new layer of skin to cover the wearers’ foot, and I therefore choose high quality cow leather and soft sheepskin for shoe linings.

My customers can also receive a pair of individual custom-made shoe lasts which can speed up the future shoe-making process - for additional pairs or new designs for example.

What are shoe lasts? 

Shoe lasts represent the anatomical information of the client’s foot, whilst at the same time giving the finished shoe a pleasing and fashionable appearance. They are used as a mould for creating the shoe’s exact shape. 

Your unique shoe last will be created by a 3-D scanner, coupled with 3-D software and a 3-D printer which is using for prototyping. This means that the shoes will be a perfect fit and be matched exactly to your foot.

Once the shoe lasts are finished, they will be reproduced using standard materials, meaning you will have a pair of tailored shoes lasts a couple of months later.  


What We Need & What You Get

Having produced and manufactured my Now the High Heeled Hybrids, I need your help to take this project to the next step. I need approximately £4,500 to travel to Paris and display the prototyped shoes at an exhibition during Paris Fashion Week from the 4th to 10th of March, 2016. It would be fantastic exposure to display them to hundreds of thousands people, including top industry experts. A final total of £30,000 will make the project move several steps forward with production of my shoes in the most popular sizes.

Because new moulds (shoe lasts) have to be made for each size of shoe, the amount of money I raise will determine how many sizes I can produce. Importantly, if I raise more I would also be able to purchase proper equipment and installations to extend this project and create new designs.

● If you pledge £3 or more

The will take this project one step closer to fruition. Every little help counts will be greatly appreciated. Pledge if you think my project is worth it!

● If you pledge £29 or more for postcards/ pictures

I will send you a suit of my design postcard (7 pieces in total) 

● If you pledge £69 or more

You will receive a VIP invitation to my coming exhibition in Paris and a suit of my design postcards (7 pieces in total).

Also, you will have the chance to discuss your own shoe design ideas with the designer. This will take place either at the exhibition in Paris, or via Skype (maximum duration 20 minutes).

Feedback will then be send via email. 

● If you pledge £1390 or more

You will get a pair of limited edition of High Heeled Hybrids shoes, and you can choose any designs from design N.1 to N.4. (shipping not including)

● If you pledge £1990 or more

You will get pair of unique limited edition of High Heeled Hybrids of  N.5 or N.6. (shipping not including)





Design N. 1


Design N. 2


Design N. 3


Design N. 4


Design N. 5


Design N. 6






Risks & Challenges

I have carefully chosen my collaborated studios and factories based on reliability and experience. 

We have had a long collaboration and I’m confident that I can keep to the schedule outlined and deliver everything on time. 

However, there will always be the risks of delays in any manufacturing process and delivery. 

Yet I'm ready to undertake this challenge and I will take any precaution to protect my customers from such event.

The new material for my High Heel Hybrids has already been examined; it’s strong and flexible.

However, I suggest avoiding doing extremely intense exercise and dancing in High Heeled Hybrids as it could damage your shoes.  



Who is the shoe designer



Zoe Jia-Yu Dai, is a footwear designer who began her career in London, UK and now based in Taiwan, in the Asia-Pacific region. She was the prestigious winner of The Cordwainers Dato' JIMMY CHOO AWARD in 2014.

Zoe graduated from the London College of Fashion with a Master of Arts in Footwear Design in January 2015. Prior to taking the Master’s courses in London, she was trained in footwear production at the Innovation Incubation Center of International Textile & Fashion Design in Taiwan. Zoe expanded her design experiences by designing a series of personal works and cooperating with manufacturers to present her own collection of works and presenting her collections of work pieces in exhibitions. Therefore, she possesses a comprehensive set of technical knowledge in footwear construction and pattern designs.

Zoe has been interested in the possible applications of 3-D printing technology for many years, and uses her shoe designs to combine this technology with a high level of craftsmanship using traditional shoe making techniques. Zoe's inspiration to create a partly 3-D printed shoe came from a desire to look at ways to change and challenge the process of footwear manufacture. It was clear that 3-D printing could not only achieve this, but would also allow a large amount of flexibility in the design stage. This allowed Zoe as a designer to push the limits of design structures.

In 2014, Zoe Jia-Yu Dai established her eponymous footwear label, ZOE DAI in London. 





Thank you for supporting and sharing this project.

story:
Changing careers, or starting a business is not always easy. The transition can be painful and uncertain, but when you trust the lord and have faith he will direct your path.. Thank You for visiting my Indiegogo campaign. My name is Shavonne Williams and I recently graduated from the University Of Central Florida business incubator program (see the link below for more details) for my unique business idea. I discovered an innovative way to prevent lost and found while producing school uniforms and accessories. On January 2, 2019 I’ll be moving into my UCF incubator office where I’ll be working with experts to take my business to the next level. Prior To moving Into my work space, I have several expenses that I need to cover to get the ball rolling; Marketing, Samples, Permits etc .. So I’m here to ask for your help! With a small donation it will help tremendously. For donation, I will customize a Sweater, Blanket or Scarf just in time for the holidays. 

https://incubator.ucf.edu/

story:
For the past 6 years I have poured my creativity and passion into this project. It truly is, a culmination of my life's work and I am so grateful that I will soon be able to share this healing space with you!  My dream was to create a place that would provide New Yorkers with that I felt was lacking: nature, peace, water, relaxation and make it affordable and accessible, cityWell Brooklyn, is that place.

cityWell, will be the only boutique bathhouse of its kind in New York City. With competitive pricing,  urban location and superior design, it will be a stand out from other bathhouses in the city.   Offering top of the line quality of service and equipment:  Steam room,  luxurious rain showers,  cedar relaxation area and treatment room along with an amazing 1,500 feet of outdoor space, it will be unlike anything that exists in Brooklyn. Treatments such as massage therapy, acupuncture, private yoga and wellness coaching will be offered as well as educational talks on health and nutrition. Truly, paradise in the city!



The mission of cityWell is to: provide a place that will help you live better and feel better while living in "the city". The Vision is to make preventive health care affordable and accessible to a broad range of urban residents. Integrating the healing qualities of nature and the elements of wood, fire, earth and water, into the experience. cityWell will be unlike anything Brooklyn has seen, and a model for more of its kind in the future, where wellness and self care become part of everyday life, not just a luxury.

For me, the meaning of this "boutique" is a small, intimate space that has thoughtfully hand picked items that are beautiful and functional and have been given a lot of thought to enhance the quality of life. The "bathhouse" refers to the ancient tradition of communal bathing and taking care of one's body that has been practiced throughout the ages and has brought much joy and health benefits to those who partake. My desire is to bring these essential and ancient healing traditions to life in a way that is easy to access and affordable. City dwellers will be able to make this ritual of self care part of everyday life, not just a luxury!

                                         


  • Having lived with a chronic digestive illness since the age of 13,  I realized the impact that my health or lack their of, can have on one's quality of life. When I eventually regained my health at age 26 through a lot of focus and the healing modalities of acupuncture, hydrotherapy, diet, yoga and meditation, I was able to experience self healing and see the clear connection of how I cared for my body had an enormous impact on my health.  My health has become a tremendous gift, and that I now have it, I what to give back to others who may be needing healing in any form, emotionally, mentally or physically, or just needing a break from every day life. It is a place to heal and prevent illness too!

  • $20,000 will help me to finish up construction on the interior space which is almost done!!  And help me to open my doors later this SUMMER!
  • The other $20,000 will go towards the outdoor oasis, which will include a whirlpool, outdoor cedar sauna, shower and relaxation areas, fire pit,  massage/treatment area, and yoga platform.
  • Any additional capital will help to fund my product line called line "cityWell Essentials" which includes an aromatherapy line, fragrance line, eye pillows, hot water bottles, bath salts, clay masks, and salt scrubs.
  • Even if the goal is not fully reached, your contributions will go towards the final stages of construction on the interior space, which is very close to complete!

    • All the aromatherapy and body products are  part of my wellness line called "cityWell Essentials" and have been in development over the past five years. They are made with by hand with quality products and materials. Whenever possible items that are sources are made in the US.  They are made with the concept of being able to bring wellness with you where ever you are in the country and the world and remembering that cityWell is not only a place, but a way of life~
  •  The deep roots of cityWell came from wanting to create a place to support the concept of: healthier habits, lead to healthier people and in turn a healthier community and city! The benefits of nature and hydrotherapy can decrees stress, improve quality of sleep,  lower blood pressure, and increase overall quality of life! By supporting this project, you will not only help me live out my dream but, you will be benefiting the health and wellness of this Brooklyn community as a whole.


Please check out the perks and give what you can to bring cityWell to life!!  Any amount is helpful and greatly appreciated!!  Spreading the word to friends and family about the project and sharing the link via social media is also a wonderful way to show support! Everything helps! I so appreciate your generosity! 

Thank you so much~

Liz


*Architectural renderings by mariotti studios

 ritual of self care part of everyday life, not just a luxury!


                                         



Having lived with a chronic digestive illness since the age of 13,  I realized the impact that my health or lack their of, can have on one's quality of life. When I eventually regained my health at age 26 through a lot of focus and the healing modalities of acupuncture, hydrotherapy, diet, yoga and meditation, I was able to experience self healing and see the clear connection of how I cared for my body had an enormous impact on my health.  My health has become a tremendous gift, and that I now have it, I what to give back to others who may be needing healing in any form, emotionally, mentally or physically, or just needing a break from every day life. It is a place to heal and prevent illness too!




$20,000 will help me to finish up construction on the interior space which is almost done!!  And help me to open my doors later this SUMMER!

The other $20,000 will go towards the outdoor oasis, which will include a whirlpool, outdoor cedar sauna, shower and relaxation areas, fire pit,  massage/treatment area, and yoga platform.
Any additional capital will help to fund my product line called line "cityWell Essentials" which includes an aromatherapy line, fragrance line, eye pillows, hot water bottles, bath salts, clay masks, and salt scrubs.
Even if the goal is not fully reached, your contributions will go towards the final stages of construction on the interior space, which is very close to complete!



All the aromatherapy and body products are  part of my wellness line called "cityWell Essentials" and have been in development over the past five years. They are made with by hand with quality products and materials. Whenever possible items that are sources are made in the US.  They are made with the concept of being able to bring wellness with you where ever you are in the country and the world and remembering that cityWell is not only a place, but a way of life~

 The deep roots of cityWell came from wanting to create a place to support the concept of: healthier habits, lead to healthier people and in turn a healthier community and city! The benefits of nature and hydrotherapy can decrees stress, improve quality of sleep,  lower blood pressure, and increase overall quality of life! By supporting this project, you will not only help me live out my dream but, you will be benefiting the health and wellness of this Brooklyn community as a whole. 




Please check out the perks and give what you can to bring cityWell to life!!  Any amount is helpful and greatly appreciated!!  Spreading the word to friends and family about the project and sharing the link via social media is also a wonderful way to show support! Everything helps! I so appreciate your generosity! 
Thank you so much~
Liz

*Architectural renderings by mariotti studios

story:
Update: We have ordered the production mold!

I am excited to announce that we are going to be able to deliver the product that you have all been so kind to partner in.  In our search for a manufacturer, we found a Florida company who are experts in producing custom pulp-paper products.  They recommended a different manufacturing process that is better suited to the strength and stiffness we will be building to.  As a side benefit, the mold is much less expensive.  Because you took a chance on me, I decided to take a chance and buy the mold now.  We should have it in about 4-5 weeks!


New Feature:  Scraping Ribs Added

I have been running prototypes and one issue I found is that the smooth portions of the scrubber can get "loaded" when there is heavy grease on the grill.  So I added ribs along the contact surface to scrape away the oil and stubborn crust.  Here is an image of the updated design that will be coming with the new molds.


Why we chose Recycled Material

Tons of valuable paper resources can be saved from our landfills with every creative new idea .  Recycled paper is so versatile that we already use it to make coffee filters, egg trays, and heavy-duty protective packaging.  With EcoScrub, we have the rare opportunity to create a new use for recycled paper that also solves a long-standing problem. 

The Problem

Grills are dirty and we have created numerous devices to fend off the grime.  But each solution has its problems.  Nobody washes their grill brush after every meal.  We put it back in the drawer... to rust... and "ferment".  The next time we grill, we rub that same brush all over the grill.  A mixture of cleaning and spreading.


The Dangers

There have been numerous reports on the dangers of ingesting bristles from grill brushes.  In fact, ABC News' Good Morning America just aired a segment on a Connecticut woman who needed to have emergency surgery!



My Story

I had gone out back to fire up the grill for the first cookout of the season only to find that there was caked-on food and grease from my previous party.  No problem, I'll just get out the wire brush and take the worst of it off.  I opened the utensil drawer to find the brush so rusty that even I couldn't bring myself to use it.  That's why I keep a backup...  Only the backup was filled with grill grease and actually had mold growing on it.  If my wife catches me using this on the grill, we will never eat at home again!

So I went inside to get a wad of wet paper towels because that would be better than nothing.  On my way, I saw some pulp-molded material on the counter.  I bet that will work.  As it turned out, I was amazed by how well it worked.  The thick pulp paper was soft enough to mold to the grill grate but firm enough to rub off the caked on food and swab away the grease as well.

What Happened Next

I was so excited that I got to work on it immediately and asked a friend of mine, Scot, to help.  We designed the first concept using Google Sketchup then sent it to a real CAD designer to make the 3D Printed model and mold design.  Here is a picture of the 3D model.  The scrubber will look just like this.  A single, formed piece of pulp paper material making a handle in the middle with grill ridges on the bottom.  Think of those cup-holders from McDonald's and you will get the idea:


So this is where we hit the roadblock.  We have to use a special mold to build the scrubbers.  It is a solid piece of aluminum milled out to exacting specs, and we need more than one.  Let's just say it is a little outside of my budget.  Most of the other big decisions have already been sorted out.  We have found a manufacturer who is willing to take on our project as long as we purchase in minimum lot sizes.  We have found a suitable storage space for our inventory.  We have even gotten our patent filed through a Patent Attorney.

What We Need to Realize Our Plans

Our plan is to manufacture this Patent Pending product for all of us in the Indiegogo community and then use the feedback to see if we are ready to expand to a larger market.  What we need is:

  • $16,000 for the molds
  • $6,000 for the minimum lot order
  • $2,000 for shipping and miscellaneous expenses

Risks & Challenges

We have done most of the legwork already, but we have been told that pulp paper molding is more of an art than a science.  The biggest risk is that the molds could need to be modified upon inspection of the first articles.  This is a possibility and would add 3 weeks and a few thousand dollars to the budget.  We are prepared to cover that expense ourselves if such a situation occurs.

How You Can Help

Please consider taking advantage of the perks we are offering.  Even small contributions help and can get you posted on the Wall of Fame at my website www.grillscrubbers.com.  If you can't, would you click the blue facebook share button next to the video above and like us on our Facebook page.  With your help, we can introduce a product that will make both the earth, and our grills,  a lot cleaner!


Perk 1: "I Scrub (Love) My Grill" T-Shirt




Perk 2: A Year's Supply of Grill Scrubbers


Perk 3: Two Year's Supply of Grill Scrubbers + T-Shirt

How You Can Help
Please consider taking advantage of the perks we are offering.  Even small contributions help and can get you posted on the Wall of Fame at my website www.grillscrubbers.com.  If you can't, would you click the blue facebook share button next to the video above and like us on our Facebook page.  With your help, we can introduce a product that will make both the earth, and our grills,  a lot cleaner!

Perk 2: A Year's Supply of Grill Scrubbers

story:
About me, Orcraphics and cross stitch

Cross stitch is my absolute passion. I started both stitching and the entire company through my love for Killer Whales (hence our logo). My aunt bought me my first stamped (pre-printed) cross stitch project because it had killer whales on it. Slowly but surely cross stitch has started to take over my life, and I wouldnt want it any other way!

Orcraphics Cross Stitch is my own cross stitch brand. We sell worldwide and have shops on Etsy, Amazon (US and UK) besides our own webshops on our website. We work with retailers in the Netherlands. We make realistic cross stitch designs with low amounts of colours and grouped stitches so they are simple and fun to stitch. 

We dont convert photos, but use them as molds as to hold on to the photorealism but without the enormous amounts of colours and loose stitches.Though we are blessed to work with a couple very talented wildlife photographers, I want and need to expand to other themes. In order to do that, we need stock photos. Hopefully, thats where you come in.

What We Need & What You Get

Your contribution will be used to buy stock photos with extended licenses. We try to stay away from the more well known, but also more expensive stock photo platforms so we can buy as many as possible. But we always judge by quality, not just the prices.

Then the magic happens, we use that photo as a mold to create a stitchable but realistic cross stitch design. That design will either be sold as a seperate pattern also known as charts, or as a complete kit that contains everything you need to finish the project (needle, floss, fabric etc). There are too many new directions we want to grow in to name them all, but just to list a few:

  • People: we only have animals now and we really want to buy pictures of humans, but we need the right release forms in order to use someone's face
  • Fantasy: fairies, elves, angels, dragons, mermaids, vampires, witches, magic scenes, it would open up a whole new world!
  • Halloween: I love Halloween, and would love to make some scary designs
  • Architecture: Buildings, houses, even castles! From places all around the world I can't get to myself, or am unable to find information about (buildings can be copyrighted too!)
  • Pets: They are animals, but certainly not wildlife
  • Plants and flowers: We plan to photograph some of these ourselves, as I am not a bad photographer myself. But certain settings or special flowers I can't get photos of without the use of stock photos
  • Christmas: More Christmas! I love christmas time. We have a few christmas designs, but the really fun, high quality and detailed images are out of our reach. As the person who made them (deservingly!) wants to be paid for their effort.
What if the goal is not reached?
Well, the cheapest extended licenses we have been able to find are in the 10-15 euros range. So if we dont make our goal, it simple means we will be able to buy less than the estimated 20-30 photos we can buy for our goal amount. But as we dont have that many products at the moment (about 70) even a few pictures can make a big difference. Especially if you consider the new customers you can attract that are not looking for wildlife.

Perks

We will be forever gratefull, no matter if you have contributed 1 euro or a 1000. We have tried to include perks for those of you who dont do cross stitch yourself. But if you want something a little different, just contact me and I will see what I can do for you. 

Remember, the finished pieces will be stitched by hand! So it will take a while to finish them for you.

Risks & Challenges

The only risk in this is that we buy the wrong photos. Meaning, the resulting designs are not selling. This is always the risk of any business, it does not even matter whether you buy the products from the producer or wholesaler of if you are the producer as in our case. I think the odds of this are lower than for other companies as I have been a cross stitcher all my life and I know the market and the needs. Also I keep a very close eye on different Facebook groups around cross stitching and I listen very carefully at craft faires to learn what people are looking for.

We test the photos before buying them to see if they work, by a simple conversion program that will tell us if the details will even 'fit' in a certain size cross stitch kit and how the colours turn out. We simply use the photo with watermark to test this. Aside from the watermark, we have always tested photos this way, so there is no risk of buying photos that ultimately cant be made into a cross stitch design.

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course there are a couple of other ways you can help.

  • Spread the word! Share this crowdfunding projects with anyone and everyone. The more people who even know about this project, the better! Dont forget Indiegogo provides you with many ways of sharing!
  • Like our website or facebook page and let people know what a fun cross stitch brand we are!
  • If you stitch yourself, and have just spend all of your money on cross stitch supplies (been there, done that!) and you like our products, subscribe to our newsletter and keep updated about our progress.
  • If you know something, have any ideas or have skills you believe can help us in any way, let us know!

If you stitch yourself, and have just spend all of your money on cross stitch supplies (been there, done that!) and you like our products, subscribe to our newsletter and keep updated about our progress.

story:
Who We Are

EcoEquitable is a dynamic, women-led charity and social enterprise based in Ottawa. We employ immigrant and marginalized women to transform discarded and recycled fabrics by sewing them into beautiful things like conference bags and corporate gifts. We transform materials, people, situations, environments, perspectives, and the world.

We are women crafting a better story.

 

Summary

In the midst of this unprecedented global pandemic, our healthcare workers are heroes. As most of us are quarantining and cooped up in our homes, they are on the front lines and risking their lives every single day in order to save the lives of others. So we decided to find some small way to thank them for everything that they do.

As it turns out, wearing a surgical mask all day every day is hard on your ears. It becomes incredibly painful. That’s the daily reality of the people who are dedicating themselves to helping others. In order to show our thanks in some small way, we’ve created a solution—a headband with buttons on it that they can hook the mask onto. Since we can’t give them all hugs and tell them how grateful we are, this is our way of showing every single one of them that we are all in this together.

We want to create thousands of these headbands and send them to as many healthcare workers as possible. We will begin with Ottawa hospitals and health facilities, then Ontario, and then all of Canada. Let’s do everything we can to make the lives of our healthcare workers just a little bit easier.

Note that all contributions are eligible for a charitable receipt.  We will mail out all receipts at the end of the campaign for donations $20 and over.  Thank you!

 

The Impact

We need your help to buy fabric, employ our seamstresses, coordinate the effort, properly sterilize everything, and cover postage, so that we can show healthcare workers across Canada how thankful we are for them and everything they do.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help financially, that's okay. We totally understand. You can still support the campaign just by sharing this page with others!
